intro: Callothlaspi camlikense, commonly known as the Turkish bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to violet. The plant typically grows in rocky or mountainous regions, preferring well-drained soils. It has hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves, and it blooms during the summer months. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
